text: The Spetses Museum is a diachronic museum in Spetses, Greece. Its exhibits cover 4000 years of the island's cultural history. It is housed in the mansion of Chatzigiannis-Mexis, which was built in 1798. The first floor is open to the public. ==External links== *Ministry of Culture and Tourism / (in Greek) *Ministry of Foreign Affairs *Municipality of Spetses *Greek Museums Guide Category:History museums in Greece Category:Museums in Attica
title: Spetses Museum
